name: Sun
description: The Sun is a big ball of fire. It's very, very hot! It gives us light and keeps us warm. Without the Sun, we wouldn't be able to live!
sizeComparison: The Sun is about 109 times wider than the Earth!
massComparison: The Sun is about 333,000 times heavier than the Earth!
tempComparison: The Sun's surface is about 20 times hotter than the hottest place on Earth!
surfaceDetails: The Sun's surface is a sea of super-hot, glowing gas called plasma. It's always bubbling and bursting with energy! Don't get too close—it's way too hot!

name: Mercury
description: This is Mercury! It's small and very hot!
surfaceDetails: Mercury's surface is rocky, gray, and covered in craters from space rocks. It's super hot during the day and freezing at night! No air, no water, just rocks and dust.

name: Venus
description: This is Venus! Super bright and very hot!
surfaceDetails: Venus is covered in thick yellow clouds and its surface is rocky, with lots of volcanoes. It's the hottest planet—hotter than an oven! The air is thick and poisonous.

name: Earth
description: This is Earth! Our home with water, trees, animals, and people!
surfaceDetails: Earth's surface has land, water, trees, mountains, deserts, and oceans. It's the only planet we know with life!

moons.name: Moon
moons.description: Earth's only natural satellite. The Moon is covered in craters and dust. It affects Earth's tides and lights up our night sky!
moons.surfaceDetails: The Moon's surface is dusty, rocky, and full of craters. There is no air or water, and the temperature swings from very hot to very cold!

name: Mars
description: This is Mars! It's red and dusty like a desert!
surfaceDetails: Mars is dusty and red, with giant volcanoes, deep canyons, and lots of rocks. Sometimes there are big dust storms! It's very cold and dry.

moons.name: Phobos
moons.description: Phobos is the larger and closer of Mars' two moons. It's irregularly shaped and orbits Mars very quickly!
moons.surfaceDetails: Phobos is covered in dust and craters. It's slowly spiraling toward Mars and will one day crash into the planet or break up into a ring!

moons.name: Deimos
moons.description: Deimos is the smaller and farther of Mars' two moons. It's lumpy and covered in craters.
moons.surfaceDetails: Deimos is small, lumpy, and covered in craters and dust. It orbits Mars much farther out than Phobos.

name: Jupiter
description: This is Jupiter! The biggest planet with a big storm!
surfaceDetails: Jupiter doesn't have a solid surface—it's made of swirling clouds and gas! If you could go down, you'd find storms and lightning everywhere.

moons.name: Io
moons.description: Io is the most volcanic body in the solar system! Its surface is covered with volcanoes, lava lakes, and colorful sulfur.
moons.surfaceDetails: Io's surface is yellow, orange, and red from sulfur and lava. Volcanoes erupt all the time, making it a wild and dangerous place!

moons.name: Europa
moons.description: Europa is covered in smooth ice. Scientists think there might be a salty ocean under the ice, maybe with life!
moons.surfaceDetails: Europa's surface is bright, smooth ice with cracks and lines. Underneath, there may be a deep, salty ocean!

moons.name: Ganymede
moons.description: Ganymede is the largest moon in the solar system—even bigger than Mercury! It has its own magnetic field.
moons.surfaceDetails: Ganymede's surface has bright and dark patches of ice and rock, with lots of craters and grooves.

moons.name: Callisto
moons.description: Callisto is covered in craters and is one of the oldest landscapes in the solar system.
moons.surfaceDetails: Callisto's surface is icy, dark, and full of craters. It's very old and hasn't changed much in billions of years!

moons.name: Amalthea
moons.description: Amalthea is a small, reddish, irregularly shaped moon. It is the largest of Jupiter's inner moons and is covered in craters.
moons.surfaceDetails: Amalthea's surface is red, irregular, and covered in craters and grooves.

moons.name: Himalia
moons.description: Himalia is the largest of Jupiter's outer irregular moons. It is elongated and dark.
moons.surfaceDetails: Himalia is dark and elongated, with a heavily cratered surface.

moons.name: Elara
moons.description: Elara is a dark, irregular moon and the second largest of Jupiter's outer moons.
moons.surfaceDetails: Elara is dark and irregular, with a heavily cratered surface.

moons.name: Pasiphae
moons.description: Pasiphae is a retrograde, irregular moon of Jupiter, dark and heavily cratered.
moons.surfaceDetails: Pasiphae is dark, irregular, and orbits Jupiter in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Sinope
moons.description: Sinope is a retrograde, irregular moon of Jupiter, dark and heavily cratered.
moons.surfaceDetails: Sinope is dark, irregular, and orbits Jupiter in a retrograde direction.

name: Saturn
description: This is Saturn! The planet with the beautiful rings!
surfaceDetails: Saturn is a gas giant with a thick atmosphere. It has beautiful rings made of ice and rock, and many moons.

moons.name: Titan
moons.description: Titan is Saturn's largest moon and has a thick, orange atmosphere. It's the only moon in the solar system with stable liquids on its surface!
moons.surfaceDetails: Titan's surface is covered with lakes and rivers of liquid methane and ethane. Its thick, orange atmosphere hides the surface from view.

moons.name: Enceladus
moons.description: Enceladus is a small, icy moon with geysers that shoot water into space. Scientists think it has a global ocean beneath its surface!
moons.surfaceDetails: Enceladus has a bright, icy surface with cracks and geysers that spray water into space.

moons.name: Mimas
moons.description: Mimas is known as the 'Death Star moon' because of its huge crater. It's one of Saturn's smallest round moons.
moons.surfaceDetails: Mimas has a giant crater called Herschel that makes it look like the Death Star from Star Wars!

moons.name: Tethys
moons.description: Tethys is an icy moon with a huge canyon and a giant impact crater.
moons.surfaceDetails: Tethys has a huge canyon called Ithaca Chasma and a giant impact crater named Odysseus.

moons.name: Dione
moons.description: Dione is an icy moon with bright, wispy streaks on its surface.
moons.surfaceDetails: Dione's surface is bright and icy, with many craters and wispy streaks.

moons.name: Rhea
moons.description: Rhea is Saturn's second largest moon and is heavily cratered and icy.
moons.surfaceDetails: Rhea's surface is icy and covered in craters. It may have a thin atmosphere.

moons.name: Iapetus
moons.description: Iapetus is famous for its two-tone coloration: one side is very dark, the other is bright.
moons.surfaceDetails: Iapetus has a unique two-tone coloration, with one dark hemisphere and one bright hemisphere.

moons.name: Hyperion
moons.description: Hyperion is a spongy-looking, irregular moon that tumbles as it orbits Saturn.
moons.surfaceDetails: Hyperion's surface is full of deep craters, making it look like a giant sponge!

moons.name: Phoebe
moons.description: Phoebe is a dark, irregular moon that orbits Saturn backward!
moons.surfaceDetails: Phoebe is dark and irregular, with a giant crater and a retrograde orbit.

moons.name: Janus
moons.description: Janus is a small, irregular moon that shares its orbit with Epimetheus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Janus is irregularly shaped and shares its orbit with Epimetheus.

moons.name: Epimetheus
moons.description: Epimetheus is a small, potato-shaped moon that shares its orbit with Janus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Epimetheus is potato-shaped and shares its orbit with Janus.

moons.name: Pandora
moons.description: Pandora is a small, elongated moon that helps shape Saturn's F ring.
moons.surfaceDetails: Pandora is elongated and helps keep Saturn's F ring in shape.

moons.name: Prometheus
moons.description: Prometheus is a small, potato-shaped moon that also helps shape Saturn's F ring.
moons.surfaceDetails: Prometheus is potato-shaped and helps keep Saturn's F ring in shape.

moons.name: Telesto
moons.description: Telesto is a small, smooth moon that shares its orbit with Tethys.
moons.surfaceDetails: Telesto is smooth and shares its orbit with Tethys.

moons.name: Calypso
moons.description: Calypso is a small, irregular moon that also shares Tethys' orbit.
moons.surfaceDetails: Calypso is irregular and shares its orbit with Tethys.

moons.name: Atlas
moons.description: Atlas is a small, flying-saucer-shaped moon that orbits just outside Saturn's A ring.
moons.surfaceDetails: Atlas is shaped like a flying saucer and orbits just outside Saturn's A ring.

moons.name: Pan
moons.description: Pan is a tiny, walnut-shaped moon that orbits within Saturn's rings.
moons.surfaceDetails: Pan is walnut-shaped and orbits within Saturn's rings.

moons.name: Helene
moons.description: Helene is a small, potato-shaped moon that shares its orbit with Dione.
moons.surfaceDetails: Helene is potato-shaped and shares its orbit with Dione.

moons.name: Polydeuces
moons.description: Polydeuces is a tiny moon that also shares Dione's orbit.
moons.surfaceDetails: Polydeuces is tiny and shares its orbit with Dione.

moons.name: Pallene
moons.description: Pallene is a tiny moon that orbits between Mimas and Enceladus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Pallene is tiny and orbits between Mimas and Enceladus.

moons.name: Methone
moons.description: Methone is a tiny, egg-shaped moon with a very smooth surface.
moons.surfaceDetails: Methone is egg-shaped and has a very smooth surface.

moons.name: Anthe
moons.description: Anthe is a tiny moon that orbits close to Methone and Pallene.
moons.surfaceDetails: Anthe is tiny and orbits close to Methone and Pallene.

moons.name: Aegaeon
moons.description: Aegaeon is a tiny moon that orbits within Saturn's G ring.
moons.surfaceDetails: Aegaeon is tiny and orbits within Saturn's G ring.

name: Uranus
description: This is Uranus! The sideways planet with rings!
surfaceDetails: Uranus is a gas giant with a blue color due to methane in its atmosphere. It has faint rings and many moons.

moons.name: Miranda
moons.description: Miranda is one of Uranus' moons, and it's known for its strange surface features, including large canyons and ice cliffs.
moons.surfaceDetails: Miranda has a very thin atmosphere and is mostly made of water ice and rock. Its surface is very bright and has many craters.

moons.name: Ariel
moons.description: Ariel is one of Uranus' moons, and it's known for its bright, icy surface and many craters.
moons.surfaceDetails: Ariel's surface is bright and icy, with many craters. It may have a subsurface ocean of water and ammonia.

moons.name: Umbriel
moons.description: Umbriel is one of Uranus' moons, and it's known for its dark, heavily cratered surface.
moons.surfaceDetails: Umbriel's surface is dark and heavily cratered, with some bright spots. It may have a subsurface ocean of water.

moons.name: Titania
moons.description: Titania is the largest moon of Uranus and has a mixed surface of ice and rock. It may have a subsurface ocean.
moons.surfaceDetails: Titania's surface is a mix of ice and rock, with many craters. It may have a subsurface ocean of water and ammonia.

moons.name: Oberon
moons.description: Oberon is the second largest moon of Uranus. Its surface is covered with craters and bright rays, and it may have a rocky core and icy mantle.
moons.surfaceDetails: Oberon's surface is icy and heavily cratered, with bright rays and possible signs of ancient geologic activity. It may have a rocky core and an icy mantle.

moons.name: Cordelia
moons.description: Cordelia is a small, inner moon of Uranus. It helps to keep Uranus' rings in place.
moons.surfaceDetails: Cordelia is small and helps keep Uranus' rings in place.

moons.name: Ophelia
moons.description: Ophelia is a small, inner moon of Uranus. It also helps to keep Uranus' rings in place.
moons.surfaceDetails: Ophelia is small and helps keep Uranus' rings in place.

moons.name: Bianca
moons.description: Bianca is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Bianca is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Cressida
moons.description: Cressida is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Cressida is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Desdemona
moons.description: Desdemona is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Desdemona is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Juliet
moons.description: Juliet is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Juliet is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Portia
moons.description: Portia is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Portia is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Rosalind
moons.description: Rosalind is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Rosalind is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Belinda
moons.description: Belinda is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Belinda is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Puck
moons.description: Puck is a dark, irregular moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Puck is dark and irregular, with many craters.

moons.name: Caliban
moons.description: Caliban is an irregular, retrograde moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Caliban is irregular and orbits Uranus in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Sycorax
moons.description: Sycorax is an irregular, retrograde moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Sycorax is irregular and orbits Uranus in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Prospero
moons.description: Prospero is an irregular, retrograde moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Prospero is irregular and orbits Uranus in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Setebos
moons.description: Setebos is an irregular, retrograde moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Setebos is irregular and orbits Uranus in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Stephano
moons.description: Stephano is an irregular, retrograde moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Stephano is irregular and orbits Uranus in a retrograde direction.

moons.name: Trinculo
moons.description: Trinculo is a small, irregular moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Trinculo is small and irregular, orbiting far from Uranus.

moons.name: Francisco
moons.description: Francisco is a small, irregular moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Francisco is small and irregular, orbiting far from Uranus.

moons.name: Margaret
moons.description: Margaret is a small, irregular moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Margaret is small and irregular, orbiting far from Uranus.

moons.name: Ferdinand
moons.description: Ferdinand is a small, irregular moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Ferdinand is small and irregular, orbiting far from Uranus.

moons.name: Perdita
moons.description: Perdita is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Perdita is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Mab
moons.description: Mab is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Mab is small and orbits close to Uranus.

moons.name: Cupid
moons.description: Cupid is a small, inner moon of Uranus.
moons.surfaceDetails: Cupid is small and orbits close to Uranus.

name: Neptune
description: This is Neptune! The windy and cold planet with rings!
surfaceDetails: Neptune is a windy, blue planet made of gas and ice. No solid ground, just wild storms and clouds!

moons.name: Triton
moons.description: Triton is Neptune's largest moon. It has geysers that shoot icy material into space and orbits Neptune backward!
moons.surfaceDetails: Triton's surface is icy, with geysers and frozen plains. It's one of the coldest places in the solar system!

moons.name: Nereid
moons.description: Nereid is Neptune's third-largest moon and has a highly eccentric orbit.
moons.surfaceDetails: Nereid has a very eccentric orbit and is thought to be a captured object.

moons.name: Naiad
moons.description: Naiad is Neptune's innermost moon, discovered by Voyager 2.
moons.surfaceDetails: Naiad is small and irregular, orbiting very close to Neptune.

moons.name: Thalassa
moons.description: Thalassa is the second closest moon to Neptune, discovered by Voyager 2.
moons.surfaceDetails: Thalassa is irregular and orbits close to Neptune.

moons.name: Despina
moons.description: Despina is a small, irregular moon of Neptune, discovered by Voyager 2.
moons.surfaceDetails: Despina is irregular and orbits close to Neptune.

moons.name: Galatea
moons.description: Galatea is a small, inner moon of Neptune, discovered by Voyager 2.
moons.surfaceDetails: Galatea is irregular and helps shape Neptune's rings.

moons.name: Larissa
moons.description: Larissa is a heavily cratered, irregular moon of Neptune, discovered by Voyager 2.
moons.surfaceDetails: Larissa is heavily cratered and irregular.

moons.name: Proteus
moons.description: Proteus is Neptune's second largest moon. It's irregularly shaped and very dark, with lots of craters.
moons.surfaceDetails: Proteus is dark and irregular, with many craters. It's one of the largest non-spherical moons in the solar system.

moons.name: Halimede
moons.description: Halimede is a small, irregular moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: Halimede is irregular and orbits far from Neptune.

moons.name: Psamathe
moons.description: Psamathe is a small, irregular moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: Psamathe is irregular and orbits far from Neptune.

moons.name: Sao
moons.description: Sao is a small, irregular moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: Sao is irregular and orbits far from Neptune.

moons.name: Laomedeia
moons.description: Laomedeia is a small, irregular moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: Laomedeia is irregular and orbits far from Neptune.

moons.name: Neso
moons.description: Neso is Neptune's most distant known moon.
moons.surfaceDetails: Neso is irregular and orbits very far from Neptune.

moons.name: Hippocamp
moons.description: Hippocamp is a tiny moon of Neptune, discovered in 2013.
moons.surfaceDetails: Hippocamp is tiny and orbits close to Neptune.

moons.name: S/2002 N5
moons.description: S/2002 N5 is a small, distant moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: S/2002 N5 is a small, distant moon of Neptune.

moons.name: S/2021 N1
moons.description: S/2021 N1 is a recently discovered distant moon of Neptune.
moons.surfaceDetails: S/2021 N1 is a recently discovered distant moon of Neptune.

name: Pluto
description: This is Pluto! A tiny dwarf planet!
surfaceDetails: Pluto is tiny and icy, with mountains made of ice and a surface covered in frozen nitrogen. It's super cold and far away!

moons.name: Charon
moons.description: Charon is Pluto's largest moon. It's so big that Pluto and Charon orbit each other like a double planet!
moons.surfaceDetails: Charon's surface is gray and icy, with canyons and craters. It's almost half the size of Pluto!

moons.name: Nix
moons.description: Nix is a small, irregular moon of Pluto. It's named after the Greek goddess of night.
moons.surfaceDetails: Nix is small and irregular, with a bright surface. It was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope in 2005.

moons.name: Hydra
moons.description: Hydra is another small moon of Pluto. It's irregularly shaped and rotates quickly.
moons.surfaceDetails: Hydra is small, irregular, and rotates quickly. It was discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope in 2005.

moons.name: Kerberos
moons.description: Kerberos is a small, dark moon of Pluto, discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope.
moons.surfaceDetails: Kerberos is small and dark, discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope in 2011.

moons.name: Styx
moons.description: Styx is Pluto's smallest known moon, discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope.
moons.surfaceDetails: Styx is Pluto's smallest moon, discovered by the Hubble Space Telescope in 2012.
